climbs.name: Opium Den
climbs.fa: Equipped by Jerry Barnett 1992, cleaned and rebolted 10/20. F.A.-Aubrey Miller 10/20

content.description: Start on a small arete feature under the big roof. The crux is between the 1st and 2nd bolts. After passing the crux you enter some amazing roof moves that end in an exposed but well protected mantel. Continue past 3 more bolts on some of the best 5.9 terrain anywhere. Stick clip the first bolt
content.protection: Permadraw anchor and permadraws on bolts 2 and 3. Bring 5 quickdraws.
content.location: Just right of "Gray Kabuki" under a large roof

content.description: Bust out your big cams for this beast. A #4 will protect you at the start but it's all #6 or bigger from the roof to the chains. Rewatch "Wideboys" for some chickenwing beta then get to roof pullin. The climbing eases after the roof move and plenty of face holds get you secure while you bump your boat anchor up the crack. I put in chain anchors and getting to the top to hang a rope is a breeze.
content.location: The obvious clean wide crack just right of Geisha Girl.

content.description: Begin by turning a small roof, then follow the bolts slightly right to a crux near the top. Watch for hollow rock through the first 2 bolts and a short run-out to the anchors. Great edges and side pulls.
content.location: Find the obvious cave at the Oriental Wall and it's the first bolted route on the left side.

content.description: Climb up past the first bolt to 2 decent crimps then launch into a really fun roof section (5.12) through 3 bolts. Pull onto the head wall for some amazing 5.9 climbing past 3 more bolts to a chain anchor. I intended for the first permadraw to be stick clipped but I left a lower first bolt that might help if you’re working the lower section. This route stays in the shade until the evening and a cave to the left puts out some nice cool air, there is also a good swimming hole 30ft from the base!       R.I.P. Tom Laughlin
Secluded area downstream from the Nasty Wall containing a handful of climbs (5.10-5.12+).
